text:
14.5. Convolutional Neural Network Model 265
Making a prediction with the ﬁt CNN model is very much like making a prediction with
the ﬁt MLP model in the previous section. The one diﬀerence is in the requirement that we
specify the number of features observed at each time step, which in this case is 1. Therefore,
when making a single one-step prediction, the shape of the input array must be: [1, n input,
1]. The model predict() function below implements this behavior.
